QAPair.Question: What is (are) Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Autoimmune hepatitis causes inflammation of the liver. It occurs when immune cells mistake the liver's normal cells for harmful invaders and attack them.

QAPair.Question: What causes Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: This form of hepatitis is an autoimmune disease . The body's immune system cannot tell the difference between healthy body tissue and harmful, outside substances. The result is an immune response that destroys normal body tissues. Liver inflammation, or hepatitis, may occur along with other autoimmune diseases. These include: Graves disease , Inflammatory bowel disease , Rheumatoid arthritis , Scleroderma , Sjögren syndrome , Systemic lupus erythematosus , Thyroiditis , Type 1 diabetes , Ulcerative colitis , Autoimmune hepatitis may occur in family members of people with autoimmune diseases. There may be a genetic cause. This disease is most common in young girls and women.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Symptoms may include: Fatigue , General discomfort, uneasiness, or ill feeling ( malaise ), Itching , Loss of appetite , Nausea or vomiting, Joint pain, Pale or clay-colored stools , Dark urine , Abdominal distention , Absence of menstruation (amenorrhea) may also be a symptom.

QAPair.Question: How to diagnose Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Tests for autoimmune hepatitis include the following blood tests: Liver function tests, Anti-liver kidney microsome type 1 antibody (anti LKM-1), Anti-nuclear antibody ( ANA ), Anti-smooth muscle antibody (SMA), Serum IgG, Liver biopsy to look for long-term hepatitis ,

QAPair.Question: What are the treatments for Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: You may need prednisone or other corticosteroid medicines to help reduce the inflammation. Azathioprine and 6-mercaptopurine are drugs used to treat other autoimmune disorders. They have also been shown to help people with autoimmune hepatitis. Some people may need a liver transplant.

QAPair.Question: What is the outlook for Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: The outcome varies. Corticosteroid medicines may slow the progress of the disease. However, autoimmune hepatitis may advance to cirrhosis. This could require a liver transplant.

QAPair.Question: What are the complications of Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Complications may include: Cirrhosis , Side effects from steroids and other medicines, Hepatocellular carcinoma , Liver failure , Bleeding from varices , Ascites , Hepatic encephalopathy ,

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Contact your health care provider if you notice symptoms of autoimmune hepatitis.

QAPair.Question: How to prevent Autoimmune hepatitis ?
QAPair.Answer: In most cases, autoimmune hepatitis cannot be prevented. Knowing the risk factors may help you detect and treat the disease early.
